g.text: Zeno was arguing that it doesn’t make sense to add inInitely many numBers together.

th digit in the decimal representation of a numBer, then
Therefore some inInite sums, or inInite series as they are called, have a meaning. ³ut
we must deIne carefully what the sum of an inInite series is.
Returning to the series in Equation 3, we denote By
OBserve that as we add more and more terms, the partial sums Become closer and closer
to 1. ²n fact, it can Be shown that By taking
large enough (that is, By adding sufIciently
many terms of the series), we can make the partial sum
as close as we please to the num-
Ber 1. ²t therefore seems reasonaBle to say that the sum of the inInite series is 1 and to
